attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk4StZp0LeU8nMdRfo_description
attribs.current:
Great Weapon Fighting

When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LVk4pey2XeMKzL76WXd_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk7gy6B1t9JAopS7rs_description
attribs.current: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk7lRm8phLZDzZkugf_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance against poison damage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk7qn8astUvpmp8NtM_description
attribs.current: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk7y3lKEevZSuYSL1w_description
attribs.current: You gain proficiency with one of smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk847y2hHbHZyfXdls_description
attribs.current: Whenever you make a History check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk8AQgMLlYqYjKId5i_description
attribs.current: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVk8dVaZxaOug2Q0ZrR_description
attribs.current: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LVyB5iaAzRajS8iGt4N_description
attribs.current:
Brute Force
Starting at 3rd level, whenever you hit with a weapon that you're proficient with and deal damage, the weapon's damage increases by an amount based on your level in this class, as shown on the Brute Bonus Damage table.

Brute Bonus Damage
Fighter Level	Damage Increase
3rd	1d4
10th	1d6
16th	1d8
20th	1d10

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LVyCaUavu9FaSKyG5i2_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 2d6ro<2, Damage Type: Slashing,Secondary Damage: 1d4ro<2,Secondary Damage Type: Brute,Melee Damage: 1d4ro<2

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LVyCiSo4ZfeF0D7A5fP_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LVyCiSo4ZfeF0D7A5fP_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d10, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 100/400,Secondary Damage: 1d4,Secondary Damage Type: Brute

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: We should all share a drink
